media.caption: The man who started the AI revolution.

text.headline:
Alan Turing
1912 - 1954
text.text: Alan Mathison Turing was an English mathematician, computer scientist, logician, cryptanalyst, philosopher, and theoretical biologist.

media.caption: Turing studied as an undergraduate from 1931 to 1934 at King's College, Cambridge

text.headline: Undergraduate studies
text.text: where he was awarded first-class honours in mathematics. In 1935, at the age of 22, he was elected a Fellow of King's College on the strength of a dissertation in which he proved the central limit theorem.

media.caption: On 8 June 1954, at his house at 43 Adlington Road, Wilmslow, Turing's housekeeper found him dead

text.headline: The end of an era
text.text: He had died the previous day at the age of 41. Cyanide poisoning was established as the cause of death
